problem: Courtney attended a concert and reported that the audience was 48 in number. However, Kelly went to the same concert and said that Courtney had made the mistake of overstating the number of people in attendance by 20%. If Kelly was right, 40 people really attended the concert. What was the audience size according to Courtney?

history.name: Agent_Verifier
history.content: Courtney attended a concert and reported that the audience was 48 in number. However, Kelly went to the same concert and said that Courtney had made the mistake of overstating the number of people in attendance by 20%. If Kelly was right, 40 people really attended the concert. What was the audience size according to Courtney?

history.name: chat_manager
history.content:
Hello everyone. We have assembled a great team today to answer questions and solve tasks. In attendance are:

Agent_Code_Executor:  
                I am Agent Code Executor, specializing in solving problems by writing Python code. 
                I have the ability to execute Python code, so feel free to reach out whenever you need assistance with Python programming.
Agent_Problem_Solver: 
                I am Agent Problem Solver, and I work collaboratively with other agents to tackle various challenges.
Agent_Verifier:   
                I am Agent Verifier. Please call on me when both Agent Code Executor and Agent Problem Solver have submitted their solutions, so I can verify their proposals and provide a final synthesis.

history.name: Agent_Problem_Solver
history.content: From the wording of the problem, Courtney initially reported that the audience was 48 in number. Therefore, the audience size according to Courtney was 48.

history.name: Agent_Verifier
history.content:
I agree with Agent Problem Solver. It is evident from the problem statement that Courtney reported an audience of 48 people. At this stage, we do not need to determine any further calculations or manipulations. Hence, the size of the audience according to Courtney is indeed 48. 

SOLUTION_FOUND: 48
